content.raw:
Is there a convenient way to share some notion of universal time across Gazebo? Gazebo seems to assume that T = 0 on simulation start. Is there a way to include a time offset, so that world plugins, sensors and models all have access to universal = offset + simulated?

I guess this would be useful in two ways:

1. Geomagnetism, ionospheric and satellite vehicle locations are indexed by global time, and it would be a nuisance to declare an offset in all plugins.

2. Global time can be pushed up to the ROS /clock so that rosbag saves the data as if it was recorded at simulated time, rather than wall time + simulated.

If I am overlooking something here, forgive me. However, the ```<spherical_coodinate>``` markup in SDF does this for coordinate frames / space. Why not have one for time?
